decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size:12pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="line-height:normal">The proposed roof extensions in conjunction with the f</span></span></span><span style="font-size:12pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="line-height:normal">irst floor side extension, by reason of their incompatible and poor design, would give&nbsp;rise to a visually obtrusive and incongruous form of development, which would be&nbsp;harmful to the character and appearance of the subject dwelling and the local area,&nbsp;contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 D(1) and D(11) of The&nbsp; London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></span></span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:12pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="line-height:normal">The proposed single storey rear extension, by reason of its excessive rearward projection and siting adjacent to side boundary, would result in an obtrusive and overbearing development, and&nbsp;would also lead&nbsp; to&nbsp;a&nbsp;loss of outlook&nbsp;for the occupiers of the adjacent property No.59 The Highway, Stanmore, HA7 3PL, to the detriment of their residential amenity,&nbsp;contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3. D (7) of The&nbsp; London Plan (2021),&nbsp;Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></span></span><br></p>
description: Alterations to the roof to form gable end; first floor side extension; single storey rear extension; external alteration.
